meanings.definition: A cord-like structure that connects an ovule or seed to the placenta.
meanings.sent1: The funicle of the seed helps it get nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the funicle attaches the ovule to the placenta.
meanings.sent3: The funicle of the seed was like a tiny lifeline to the mother plant.
meanings.sent4: As the funicle stretched, it resembled a bridge between the seed and the placenta.
meanings.sent5: The delicate funicle was the vital link between the seed and its source of nourishment.

meanings.definition: A slender cord or band in the body, such as a nerve fiber or muscle bundle.
meanings.sent1: The funicle in the body carries important messages.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully avoided damaging the delicate funicle during the operation.
meanings.sent3: The funicle in the body was like a tiny thread connecting different parts.
meanings.sent4: His words traveled along the funicle of understanding between them.
meanings.sent5: The funicle, like a tiny rope, connected the muscle bundle to the rest of the body.
